subject: Re: [junit] junit xml output
msgSnippet: Steve, I ve done some reverse engineering and published the structure, and how it s rendered into a report,  here:
messageBody:
Steve,

I've done some reverse engineering and published the structure, and how it's rendered into a report, here:
http://junitpdfreport.sourceforge.net/manual/junitreport_xslt_description/

Regards, Jan
----- Original Message -----
From: Stephen George
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Wednesday, April 05, 2006 9:13 AM
Subject: [junit] junit xml output



I've been searching the web over, but cannot find a reference guide to
junits xml output.

By that I mean what tags it uses, attributes etc.

Obversely I can reverse engineer the xml tags by generating faults and
looking at the xml. But I don't know if I will get the full set, or a
partial set based on the errors I can generate, however that wont
describe the difference between a failure and an error.

I'm surprised there seems to be no reference considering lots of other
tools decode the junit output (cruisecontrol,eclipse etc.)

Can anyone give me a pointer to any reference that describes the tags
and attributes that junit issues.

My aim is to convert the output of another unit (cxxTest) testing suite
into junit xml format that cruisecontrol can parse and display.

Is there a group of people who guide development for xUnit to ensure
some conformity in file formats etc ??

Thanks
Steve
